content: Please recognize my right to have an opinion, to have an informed opinion, and the ability to respond with said opinion in whatever high-level or amount of in-depth detail I desire without having someone come over and suggest I wasn’t “inclusive” enough of everyone out there. Obviously — there are health conditions that would prevent this kind of thing. I didn’t feel like writing a research journal-sized response to include all of the various ways. However- in the story and to the Author whom I was specifically responding to — it seems like the greatest error in her approach to solving this problem was in the rooted idea she could temporarily take action to consistently maintain her weight. Perhaps you don’t have a lot of self discipline or perhaps you haven’t tried to form habits. It’s not easy to do, but anyone of sound mind and body can develop these habits should they choose. You’re free to not choose them, and you might have great genes. But I wasn’t talking to you when I wrote this and perhaps you are the one who might want to pause and consider why you felt like jumping into this conversation with nothing more to contribute than an inappropriate and unnecessary criticism of another person?
